description: {"blocks":[{"key":"agdn5","text":"This protocol was designed to detect acellular oxidative reactivity of nanoparticles","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

guidelines: {"blocks":[{"key":"9ifun","text":"Health and safety precautions","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":29}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"a6crq","text":"All work should be conducted in a fume hood wearing standard personal protection equipment (lab coat, nitrile gloves, safety glasses).After use NP suspensions are filtered through a 0.2 micron syringe filter using a 10 mL plastic syringe.Dispose of the NP laden syringe filter in the Biohazard box for incineration.The filtered aqueous buffer can be disposed in the sink.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"beahg","text":"NOTE: 10M sodium hydroxide is highly corrosive.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"UNDERLINE","offset":0,"length":5}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
materials_text: {"blocks":[{"key":"9o3jr","text":"Materials","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":9}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ed380","text":"- Hydrogen peroxide solution (30 wt% in water, Sigma Aldrich cat. no. 216763)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8l7mt","text":"- 2′,7′-Dichlorodihydrofluorescein diacetate (\u003e97%, Sigma Aldrich cat. no. D6883)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3ilee","text":"     NOTE: Once opened, the solid DCFH-DA must be kept under argon at -20°C.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5qv97","text":"- Methanol (HPLC grade)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2aaha","text":"     NOTE: Can substitute with pure Ethanol 190 Proof (Decon Labs cat. no. V1101)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cadvn","text":"- PBS, 1X Phosphate-Buffered Saline (ThermoFisher cat. no. 10010023)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6e9kl","text":"- Horseradish peroxidase (~150 units/mg, 100mg, MW ~40,000 Da, Sigma Aldrich cat. no. 77332)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9nk86","text":"- Sodium hydroxide (10M in water, Sigma Aldrich cat. no. 72068)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

status.info: We use this protocol and it’s working

steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"bcjqq","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"a8i63","text":"- Hydrogen peroxide solution (30 wt% in water, Sigma Aldrich cat. no. 216763)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"264uj","text":"- 2′,7′-Dichlorodihydrofluorescein diacetate (\u003e97%, Sigma Aldrich cat. no. D6883)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cu8sq","text":"    NOTE: Once opened, the solid DCFH-DA must be kept under argon at -20°C.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bno3u","text":"- Methanol (HPLC grade)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"b3605","text":"    NOTE: Can substitute with pure Ethanol 190 Proof (Decon Labs cat. no. V1101)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"c11p9","text":"- PBS, 1X Phosphate-Buffered Saline (ThermoFisher cat. no. 10010023)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8igal","text":"- Horseradish peroxidase (~150 units/mg, 100mg, MW ~40,000 Da, Sigma Aldrich cat. no. 77332)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bmo4d","text":"- Sodium hydroxide (10M in water, Sigma Aldrich cat. no. 72068)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"5t906","text":"- Add 24.4 mg DCFH-DA (MW 487.29 g/mol) powder to a 50 mL volumetric flask.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"caavl","text":"- Fill flask to 50 mL volume line with methanol.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fgdvd","text":"- This makes a 1 mM DCFH-DA stock concentration. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1aiao","text":"- Wrap flask with aluminum foil. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6eil3","text":"- This stock solution can be stored in the freezer at -20°C for 4 months.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"5nmds","text":"- Add 114 µL of 30 wt% H2O2to a 10 mL volumetric flask.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sub","offset":24,"length":1},{"style":"sub","offset":26,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"f22t6","text":"- Fill flask to 10 mL volume line with Milli-Q water.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2d019","text":"- This makes a 0.1 M H2O2 stock solution. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sub","offset":22,"length":1},{"style":"sub","offset":24,"length":2}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9695m","text":"[This stock solution should be made fresh]","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"7mcku","text":"- Add 50 µL of 10 M NaOH to a 50 mL volumetric flask.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7fls2","text":"- Fill flask to 50 mL volume line with Milli-Q water.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"97rit","text":"- This makes a 10 mM NaOH stock solution.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"biv42","text":"[This stock solution can be stored at 22°C for 1 month]","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"cqa1j","text":"- Add 20 µL of 0.1 M H2O2 stock solution to a 10 mL volumetric flask.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sub","offset":22,"length":1},{"style":"sub","offset":24,"length":2}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"587kr","text":"- Fill flask to 10 mL volume line with Milli-Q water.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fg2an","text":"This makes a 200 µM H2O2 working solution","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sub","offset":21,"length":1},{"style":"sub","offset":23,"length":2}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"3qhb0","text":"- Add 4 mL of 10 mM NaOH and 1 mL of 1mM DCFH-DA stock solution to a 20 mL volumetric flask. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7nasq","text":"- Wrap flask in aluminum foil.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"avu10","text":"- Let the mixture react at room temperature for 30 min. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"61j1f","text":"- Quench the reaction by diluting the DCFH-DA in NaOH solution with phosphate buffer saline (1X PBS, pH 7.2-7.4) up to the 20 mL mark on the volumetric flask.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"c39e8","text":"This makes a 50 µM DCFH-DA concentration.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"eus93","text":"- Add 1 mg of horseradish peroxidase (HRP) powder (~150 units/mg) to a 50 mL volumetric flask.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fvuki","text":"- Add 10 mL of freshly prepared 50 µM DCFH solution to the flask.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1bmrj","text":"- Fill the flask to the volume line with 1X PBS.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bq1jq","text":"This makes a 10 µM DCFH with 3 unit/mL HRP working solution.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"5e1k4","text":"- If the concentration is known: prepare 1 mL of a 100 µg/mL analyte suspension by diluting the analyte stock suspension using 1X PBS as the diluent.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":32},{"style":"italic","offset":32,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"f5gmr","text":"If the concentration is unknown: prepare 1 mL of a 1:10 dilution analyte suspension by adding 100 µL of the analyte stock suspension to 900 µL 1X PBS.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":32}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4m3d8","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5epbd","text":"- Mix thoroughly using a vortex mixer or bath sonicator.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"993b9","text":"- Place a 2.5 mL Eppendorf tube inside the static eliminator built into the ultramicrobalance and run to dissipate any electrostatic charge in the plastic.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"f06kn","text":"- Weigh 0.2 mg of powder analyte directly into the Eppendorf tube.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ea0rr","text":"- Add 0.1 mL of dimethyl sulfoxide (DMSO) to disperse the powder analyte.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8dtbf","text":"- Add 1.90 mL 1X PBS.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6ioao","text":"- This makes a 100 µg/mL analyte suspension from powder.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"fkcv5","text":"- Using a multipipette, transfer 20 µL from each well in the dosing plate to a black 96-well plate. Note: Rows A \u0026 H and Column 12 will not be filled.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"haho","text":"- Using a 8-channel multipipette, add 200 µL of the DCFH – HRP working solution to wells in Columns 1-3, 5-7, 9-11.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bkv8u","text":"- Add 220 µL of the DCFH – HRP working solution to wells in Column 4.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3fl9b","text":"- Add 220 µL of 1X PBS to wells in Column 8.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"56pn9","text":"- Place the 96-well plate into the multiplate reader (Cytation 3) thermostatted at 37°C and after shaking the platefor 5 seconds, wait 2 minutes thenstart fluorescent intensity measurements.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8v64t","text":"- The fluorescence signal is measured every minute for 60 minutes. The spectroscopic reading occurs at an excitation wavelength of 485 nm and an emission wavelength of 530 nm. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1fa4o","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"c4k51","text":"Note: Data is presented by first background correcting for the DCHF-HRP signal then plotting the signal increase compared to the blank (0 µM or 0 µg/mL) at specific times or through the change in fluorescence response over time at a given concentration.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

title: Detecting the acellular oxidative reactivity of nanoparticles
title_html: Detecting the acellular oxidative reactivity of nanoparticles
